New Records: Nick Castellanos tied for the third-most walk-offs in a single season since 1974 with five walk-offs between the regular season and postseason.
Key Match Events: Nick Castellanos hit a walk-off single in the ninth inning to score Trea Turner from second base and win the game for the Phillies.
Bryson Stott hit a 3-2 slider down the right-field line to score the tying run.
Mark Vientos hit a two-run homer off Matt Strahm in the ninth inning to tie the game.
Brandon Nimmo hit a go-ahead homer against Orion Kerkering in the seventh inning.
Bryce Harper hit a two-run homer to center field in the sixth inning to cut the Phillies' deficit to 3-2.
Pre-Game Insights: There were no pre-game insights mentioned in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: Nick Castellanos said that he often has feelings that he might do something special in moments like that, but usually chases out of the zone and has to get rid of them and settle back in.
Rob Thomson said that Castellanos has been grinding all year and can hit, he's just been facing a lot of questions about his swing and approach.
Bryce Harper said that Castellanos continues to fight and work.
Matt Strahm said that Castellanos is unfazed and has shown everyone how Nick can go through anything, he's a veteran for a reason.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was tied after two games in the current 2-2-1 Division Series format, and the home team has won 66 percent of the time.
The Phillies scored three runs in the eighth inning to take a 6-4 lead, but the Mets tied it with a two-run homer in the ninth.
Castellanos' walk-off hit was his fifth walk-off hit of the year, and he reached first base, dropped his helmet, raised his arms and turned to his teammates to celebrate.
Others: The article mentions that Castellanos' season has been marked by a turnaround from a slow start, and that he has been working to improve his swing and approach.
The article also mentions that Castellanos has a history of coming up big in clutch situations, and that his walk-off hit was a testament to his professionalism and ability to perform under pressure.
